title: I bought a snap on toolbox and it's not payed off yet bit I need to sell it just for living expenses
question: I'm filling for bankruptcy I owe 6k still on it.
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Criminal defense,Criminal charges for theft
answers: legally, you don't have the right to sell that tool box until its paid off. The lender has a security interest in it, selling property that doesn't fully belong to you is a type of theft. get a free consultation with a bankruptcy attorney,there's only so much that can be said in a public forum like this.

If (1) the creditor retained a security interest in the toolbox, and (2) you sell it, keep the money, and (3) file BK, discharge of the creditor's debt may not be allowed, so you could still have to pay them. Look at your contract to find out. If you fax the contract to me, I can examine it and give you more useful information.

So what is your question? You can wipe out the3 rest you owe by including the place you make payments to in the bankruptcy. If the tool box secures the debt, the creditor may repossess it. Changing the category to bankruptcy--the toolbox I not dangerous nor defective.
